Noncredit Offerings                                                                   Claim Your Digital NYU School of Professional Studies Noncredit Certificate Badge                                                                        Play                              Noncredit Offerings at the NYU School of Professional Studies        The NYU School of Professional Studies is a leader in noncredit continuing education. People from across the country and around the world enroll in our noncredit courses , certificates , online offerings , and intensives . Professionally oriented programs are offered as well as those geared toward personal enrichment. Day, evening, and weekend schedules are available to fit your busy lifestyle. Courses are taught by top industry professionals, who provide you with the latest information in your area of interest.   No matter what your passion or career path, you will find that the School offers a noncredit learning environment like no other. From Creating Websites for Mobile Devices to Collecting and Appraising Rare Books , there is something for everyone.            Noncredit Certificate Digital Badge     Noncredit Academic Policies and Procedures    Noncredit Information Sessions     Dorothy Durkin Torch Circle Benefits    High School Academy     Intensives    Professional Advantage               Ready to Proceed?     Search for a Course Now       Download Summer 2015 Bulletin          Courses     Noncredit courses can provide the information needed to hone your current skills, learn new ones, or simply enrich your life. Choose from thousands of courses that are offered online and onsite. Many can apply towards earning noncredit certificates .         Certificates     More than 100 noncredit certificates are available from which to choose. These programs are comprised of required courses and elective courses that allow you to tailor your program of study to meet your professional goals.           Online Offerings     The NYU School of Professional Studies offers a large number of online noncredit courses. So, you can learn at home, at work, or on the road. Some courses are offered completely online, while others combine online and onsite instruction.                                                                            Advanced Certificate Search                                                       New Courses     New noncredit courses offered by the School put you on the fast track to success by helping you to acquire new skills and to expand upon existing knowledge. A wide selection of new courses are added throughout the semester.           Explore New Courses       Intensives     Intensive programs offer course content in condensed formats. They run throughout the year, but are most prevalent during the summer months. Programs range from 1-12 weeks and provide total immersion in subject matter.           Learn More About Intensives       Register for Courses     To register for a course, call (212) 998-7150; visit sps.nyu.edu ; or visit us in person at 7 East 12th Street, Room 133, Mon.–Thurs., 9 a.m.–7 p.m.; Fri., until 5 p.m; and Sat.–Sun. 9 a.m.–6 p.m.             Create an Account         Login to Your Account to Register                                               QUICK LINKS                        About Us          Student Affairs          Visit Us          School-wide Policies          Contact Us                       ATTEND THE SCHOOL                        Graduate Admissions          Undergraduate Admissions          Noncredit Registration          High School Academy          Professional Advantage                             ON THE WEB                         On Facebook          On Twitter          On YouTube          Browser Requirements                                                        NYU Homepage    © New York University School of Professional Studies | Privacy Policy

                         Bread Crumbs          Global   /   Global Academic Centers   /   NYU Washington, DC   /   Academics   /   Internships                 Sub Navigation                                 Interning in 5 Easy Steps                       The Arts                       Education                       Finance                       International                       Journalism                       Justice                       Environment                       Politics                       Science                                                                   Internships                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   NYU Washington, DC provides students with unique opportunities to intern with one of numerous organizations including NGOs, media outlets, or museums and experience first hand the close connection between international affairs and everyday life.   NYU is here to provide supports as you go through the process of finding and applying for internships. To start the process, go to our internship preparation form for PART 1 and 2 where you'll start (or continue to develop) your relationship with NYU's Wasserman Center for Career Development.     Opportunities for internships are identified in several ways. Based on your interests and course of study, select the topic that best aligns with your curriculum below. Once you have selected your area of interest, you will be directed to a page that will allow you to select the type of placement or experience you prefer. Once you select the type of placement, you will finally be directed to a list of available opportunities to which you will be able to apply. Then go back to our form to start PART 3 of our process to keep us informed of where you're applying.                                    Think Ahead!                                           Some internships require special security clearance... Click here to find out which ones!                               Many of the best internships in Washington, DC require a thorough background check by law enforcement agencies, which means you need to apply much earlier than other internship opportunities. These deadlines are often long before the application deadline for the NYU Washington, DC site . Think ahead! If you are contemplating a semester in DC, and interested in one of these placements, apply before the deadline, or the placement will not consider your application.   These placements include:     Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, & Firearms   The State Department   USAID   US Securities and Exchange Commission   The White House                            The Arts                                           Museums, theaters, advocacy groups and more...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                         Finance                                           Business, investment and world monetary organizations...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                           Justice                                           US courts, Department of Justice, Law firms and more...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                           Education                                           Schools, Smithsonian Institution, agencies and more...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                           International                                           Foreign embassies, NGOs, international relations and more...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                         Politics                                           Federal agencies, US Congress, think tanks and more...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                           Environment                                           Sustainability focused organizations and more...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                           Journalism                                           Press organizations, public relations and more...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                           Science                                           Health programs, research, urban planning and more...                               find suggested internship placements by clicking here!                         Students who secure an internship through or with the assistance of NYU Washington, DC must confirm their spot in the program and enroll in the internship class in order to accept the internship. Many NYU departments (including SCA & Environmental Studies) allow the Washington, DC internship course to satisfy major requirements. Always consult with your academic adviser to confirm how the internship course and other courses you will take while away fit in with your academic progress towards degree fulfillment. Students are required to pursue a minimum of 10 hours/week in their internships to earn course credit. NYU Washington, DC advises that students pursue no more than 20 hrs/week in internship commitments. If students elect to participate in an internship that exceeds the recommended number of hours, they may be advised to reduce their academic course load. Students are highly encouraged to consult NYU Washington DC staff for assistance with these decisions.   PLEASE NOTE: Internships that take place in Maryland, regardless of whether credit is awarded for the experience, require that your school or department have a certificate of approval to operate in the state. If you are interested in a placement in Maryland, please contact global.internships@nyu.edu before applying to the internship for more information.
